total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. In this case, the pattern is a square made up of 7s with empty spaces inside.
Q2: Identify the transformation applied in the examples. In this case, the transformation is a rotation of the square by 45 degrees.
Q3: Identify the cells that need to be changed to achieve the transformation. In this case, the cells that form the square and the empty spaces inside need to be changed.
Q4: Determine the new values for the cells identified in Q3. In this case, the new values should form a diamond shape made up of 7s with empty spaces inside.
Q5: Apply the transformation to the input grid of the quiz.
Q1: Identify the pattern of the number 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the pattern of transformation from the input grid to the output grid based on the examples.
Q3: Apply the transformation pattern to the number 7 pattern in the input grid of the quiz.
Q4: Generate the output grid based on the transformation applied in Q3.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the input grid. In this case, the pattern is a square made up of 7s with empty spaces inside.
Q2: Identify the transformation applied in the examples. In this case, the transformation is a rotation of the square by 45 degrees.
Q3: Identify the cells that need to be changed to apply the transformation. In this case, the cells that form the square and the cells inside the square need to be changed.
Q4: Determine the new values for the cells identified in Q3. In this case, the cells that were 7 become 0 and the cells that were 0 become 7.
Q5: Apply the transformation to the input grid to generate the output grid.
